revised_title: Description and Classification of a New Coot-Footed Tringa Species
tldr: The author describes a newly discovered species of snipe or tringa, which he names the coot-footed tringa, due to its webbed feet similar to the fulica or bald-coot. The bird has unique features such as scalloped and pectinated toes, a black and channelled bill, and distinctive coloration. The author also discusses the possibility of other undiscovered bird species in the region.
